title: [文宣]To people all around the world

replies.msg:
To people all around the world,

We, Hongkongers just experienced a terrorist attack planned and executed by our Hong Kong Police Force. At about 10pm today, our police force rushed into our railway system in Prince Edward station, got into the carriage and indifferently beat up all the people in it regardless they are protesters or simply passengers. They ignored the weapon guidelines and fired tear gas indoor in the carriage which is in fact lethal. Also, they beat up innocent people causing them seriously wounded. Some passengers kneeled before them asking them to stop but the response they got was beaten ever harder. Meanwhile, the police haven’t arrested the passengers after they got beaten up, showing that the only purpose of their brutality was to sort their anger to violence but not dispersing the crowd.

We, Hongkongers are experiencing a humanitarian crisis and we hope that people all over the world can help us in any way you can think of. Thank you and we will stay strong.

Hongkongers

求修改

replies.msg:
改少少，求加圖
To our friends around the world,

The Hong Kong Police Force has just launched a terrorist attack against us, their very own citizens they are supposed to protect. At around 10pm today, the police barged into our underground railway system at Prince Edward station, got into the carriage and beat all the people in it with batons indiscriminately. They ignored weapon guidelines and fired tear gas indoors inside the carriage. This can be lethal. They then proceeded to beat up innocent commuters, causing them to be seriously wounded. Some passengers kneeled before them begging for mercy, only to be inflicted with more violence. They then refused the injured access to first aid, keeping medics outside the station, thus committing a serious war crime. Curiously, no arrests were made after the horror, demonstrating that the sole purpose of their brutality was for their own catharsis rather than as a necessary use of force for crowd dispersal.

We, Hongkongers are experiencing a humanitarian crisis and we sincerely hope that people around the globe can help us in any way you can think of. Thank you and we will stay strong till the dawn comes.

Yours truly,
Hongkongers

replies.msg:
To people allaround the world,

We, Hongkongers have experienced a police-led terrorist attack. At around 10pm today, the police force rushed into the Prince Edward train station then indifferently beat up all the people in the carriage regardless of their identities. The police not only fired tear spray inside the carriage, but also they have caused several innocent people, including youths under 16, seriously wounded. Some passengers kneeled before them and asked for mercy, but the police chose to use stronger violence in respnse. The police arrested no passenger after using excessive violence. Such brutality strongly implicates that the only purpose of their violence is to express their anger and hatred to the public.

We, Hongkongers are experiencing a humanitarian crisis which is led by our government. We need your help. Please dont leave us. Thank you.

Hongkongers
